did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 57 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 4 oversize boxes, oversize memorabilia

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia, relating to Russian émigré affairs, Russian culture, Cossack history and Cossacks in emigration, and post-World War II resettlement of Russian displaced persons.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], V. G. Ulitin papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2009.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia, relating to Russian émigré affairs, Russian culture, Cossack history and Cossacks in emigration, and post-World War II resettlement of Russian displaced persons.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Russians--United States.
Cossacks.
World War, 1939-1945--Refugees.
International relief.

scopecontent.p: Transcripts of some sound recordings are in box 55
Sounds like a copy of a record.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Reverend L. Kishkovsky recorded speech: Church and State Relations in Russia Today

scopecontent.p: A talk on the history of religion in Russian History. Kishkovsky concentrates on post-Soviet Union 1990s Russia. He believes that if Russia wants to have a relationship with the Russian Orthodox Church, some amount of restitution is needed. The question-and-answer session that follows touches on the Methodist Church for some time. For dating purposes: Kishkovsky refers to Boris Yeltsin as the current president of Russia and to "President Clinton."

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Russian poetry and prose

scopecontent.p: Two voices; one male, one female. At the end, it is one female voice and a child's voice.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of radio broadcasts concerning vocal music

scopecontent.p: Most of the tape is an audio documentary on Maria Callas. The rest is an unrelated concert of voice and piano from the Library of Congress.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the Valentin Berezhkov memorial service

scopecontent.p: Family, friends, and colleagues comment on the life and character of Berezhkov. They recognize him as an eyewitness to history, a spirited political analyst, and a lover of jokes.
A woman interviews a man concerning his family and life in Russia/Soviet Union.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of an interview with Ulitin

scopecontent.p: A woman interviews Ulitin. Topics include his life growing up, family, and Cossacks.

did.unittitle: Sound recordings of interviews with Ulitin

scopecontent.p: Discussing the spirit of the Cossack people, especially in relation to state power.

did.unittitle: Sound recordings of interviews with Ulitin

scopecontent.p: A discussion of his family, past, and relationship with the church.

did.unittitle: Sound recordings of interviews with Ulitin
The collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described. Contact us at hooverarchivesinfo@stanford.edu
